title: Among the Blasphemers
summary: For at least a year, the mail room in Penguin‚Äôs New York headquarters utilized a bomb-sniffing dog‚Äînamed, for some unknown reason, Yalta‚Äîto screen packages. On one especially unnerving Saturday the few employees in Penguin‚Äôs 23rd Street office that day looked out their windows to see thousands of New York‚Äìarea Muslims who‚Äôd arrived to protest the publication of The Satanic Verses bowing to Mecca in unison. The management of the company behaved with disgraceful cowardice.

title: ICE First Look at June Mortgage Performance: "Delinquencies Trend Slightly Higher in June"
summary: From Intercontinental Exchange: ICE First Look at Mortgage Performance: Delinquencies Trend Slightly Higher in June as Foreclosure Activity Continues to Rise off Pandemic-Era Lows Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. (NYSE:ICE) ... today released its June 2025 ICE First Look, which shows that while overall mortgage payment performance remains strong, delinquencies rose on a monthly basis while foreclosures trended notably higher year over year (YoY). Key takeaways from the ICE First Look, which reports on month-end delinquency, foreclosure and prepayment statistics sourced from ICE‚Äôs loan-level database, include: ‚Ä¢ The national delinquency rate rose by 15 basis points (bps) from May to 3.35% driven by early-stage delinquencies. FHA delinquencies, which tend to experience more seasonality, rose by 41 bps in the month, hitting their highest June level since 2013, excluding the 2020-2021 pandemic-era impact. ‚Ä¢ Serious delinquencies (SDQs) ‚Äì loans 90+ days past due but not in foreclosure ‚Äì held

title: Phishers Target Aviation Execs to Scam Customers
summary: KrebsOnSecurity recently heard from a reader whose boss's email account got phished and was used to trick one of the company's customers into sending a large payment to scammers. An investigation into the attacker's infrastructure points to a long-running Nigerian cybercrime group that is actively targeting established companies in the transportation and aviation industries.
fullContent: KrebsOnSecurity recently heard from a reader whose boss‚Äôs email account got phished and was used to trick one of the company‚Äôs customers into sending a large payment to scammers. An investigation into the attacker‚Äôs infrastructure points to a long-running Nigerian cybercrime ring that is actively targeting established companies in the transportation and aviation industries. Image: Shutterstock, Mr. Teerapon Tiuekhom. A reader who works in the transportation industry sent a tip about a recent successful phishing campaign that tricked an executive at the company into entering their credentials at a fake Microsoft 365 login page. From there, the attackers quickly mined the executive‚Äôs inbox for past communications about invoices, copying and modifying some of those messages with new invoice demands that were sent to some of the company‚Äôs customers and partners. Speaking on condition of anonymity, the reader said the resulting phishing emails to customers came from a newly registered domai

title: Hiking the Border Panorama Trail - Where Austria Meets Slovenia | Hike the Line (1/3)
summary: Werner Herzog once said: ‚ÄûThe world reveals itself to those who travel on foot.‚Äú This proves even more true for those who wander along border trails ‚Äì broadening their horizon between two worlds. Follow us on some of the most beautiful and adventurous hiking trails in Europe‚Äôs frontier regions. Become witness of the peaceful growing together of neighbours once divided by the Iron Curtain when we walk along the Borderland Panoramic Trail between Austria and Slovenia. Follow the historic Customs Officers‚Äô path along the entire coastline of Brittany to relive the eponyms‚Äô efforts to prevent smuggling and customs fraud. Or discover the unspoiled nature on the Upper Lusatian Mountain Trail in the borderland between Germany, Poland and the Czech Republic, where wolf packs have found a new home. ------- Chapters ‚ñ∑ 00:00 - Intro ‚ñ∑ 01:33 - H√ºhnerkogel ‚ñ∑ 04:50 - Jatschkifels ‚ñ∑ 05:40 - St. Urban ‚ñ∑ 06:42 - Zweibach Valley ‚ñ∑ 10:08 - Borderless Radio Communication ‚ñ∑ 11:58 - St. Pongratzen ‚ñ∑ 13:50 -

New home sales continue rangebound, prices continue to decline, inventory continues to rise
summary: - by New Deal democratThis morning‚Äôs report on¬†new home sales for June indicated that sales continue to be rangebound, YoY prices continue to decline, and inventory of homes for sale continue to rise. This complicates the story of rebalancing between new and existing homes.To recapitulate, while new home sales are the most leading measure of the housing market, they are very noisy and heavily revised, which is why I generally pay more attention to single family permits. Still, if averaged over three or more months they are valuable indicators of the underlying upward or downward pressure on the economy going forward one year or more.¬†Let me begin also with a periodic reminder that sales lead prices:As well as leading inventory:Here is the YoY% change post-pandemic of all three:As per history, sales rose first, followed by prices and inventory.
